answerText: Joyce Carol Oates[10] Oates's novel What I Lived For takes its title from a chapter of this Henry David Thoreau book about living in a cabin by a lake in the woods.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 17 | 11 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: At the end of one of this author's novels, Jules pimps out a girl and commits murder during the Detroit Race Riot. For 10 points each: [10] Name this prolific author of them, A Garden of Earthly Delights, and the short story "Where Are You Going, Where Have You Been?"
